title: Getting Started
code: affirm_init(replace = TRUE) #> âœ” We're ready to make data affirmations...  # this option is used to auto-select columns that appear in the report listings  # (default are these IDs and the columns that appear in the condition being tested) options('affirm.id_cols' = "SUBJECT")

title: Getting Started
text: Affirm missing subject IDs time â€™ll affirm randomization assignment missing missing take action removing rows returned data frame. affirmation, merge data DM data set, check whether reported subject age aligns age group randomization stratification variable. example, modify data frame reported data management team. return rows data frame, include flag row bad inputs.
code: affirm_true(   RAND,   label = "RAND: Subject ID is not missing",   condition = !is.na(SUBJECT),   id = 1L,   priority = 1,   data_frames = "RAND" ) #> â€¢ RAND: Subject ID is not missing #>   0 issues identified. #> # A tibble: 5 Ã— 3 #>   SUBJECT RAND_GROUP RAND_STRATA #>     <dbl> <chr>      <chr>       #> 1       1 Drug A     <65yr       #> 2       2 Drug B     >=65yr      #> 3       3 Drug A     <65yr       #> 4       4 Drug B     >=65yr      #> 5       5 NA         >=65yr RAND <-   affirm_true(     RAND,     label = "RAND: Randomization Group is not missing",     condition = !is.na(RAND_GROUP),     data_action = filter(., !is.na(RAND_GROUP)),     id = 2L,     priority = 1,     data_frames = "RAND"   ) #> â€¢ RAND: Randomization Group is not missing #>   1 issue identified. RAND |>   left_join(     DM |> prepend_df_name() |> select(SUBJECT, DM.AGE) ,      by = "SUBJECT"   ) |>    affirm_true(     label = "RAND: Randomization strata match recorded subject age",     condition =       (RAND_STRATA %in% "<65yr" & DM.AGE < 65) | (RAND_STRATA %in% ">=65yr" & DM.AGE >= 65),     id = 3L,     priority = 1,     data_frames = "RAND, DM"   ) #> â€¢ RAND: Randomization strata match recorded subject age #>   1 issue identified. #> # A tibble: 4 Ã— 4 #>   SUBJECT RAND_GROUP RAND_STRATA DM.AGE #>     <dbl> <chr>      <chr>        <dbl> #> 1       1 Drug A     <65yr           40 #> 2       2 Drug B     >=65yr          70 #> 3       3 Drug A     <65yr           50 #> 4       4 Drug B     >=65yr          60 affirm_true(   DM,   label = "DM: Subject race is one of 'Asian', 'Black or African American', 'Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander', 'American Indian or Alaska Native', 'White'",   condition = RACE %in% c('Asian', 'Black or African American', 'Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander', 'American Indian or Alaska Native', 'White'),   report_listing =     select(., SUBJECT, RACE) |>      mutate(..flag.. = ifelse(!lgl_condition, label, NA)),   id = 4L,   data_frames = "DM" ) #> â€¢ DM: Subject race is one of 'Asian', 'Black or African American', 'Native #>   Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander', 'American Indian or Alaska Native', #>   'White' #>   1 issue identified. #> # A tibble: 4 Ã— 3 #>   SUBJECT   AGE RACE                                      #>     <dbl> <dbl> <chr>                                     #> 1       1    40 Asian                                     #> 2       2    70 Black or African American                 #> 3       3    50 Native American                           #> 4       4    60 Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander  # we'll take a peak at the 'report_listing' data frame now affirm_report_raw_data() |>    filter(id == 4L) |>    pull(data) #> [[1]] #> # A tibble: 4 Ã— 3 #>   SUBJECT RACE                                      ..flag..                     #>     <dbl> <chr>                                     <chr>                        #> 1       1 Asian                                     NA                           #> 2       2 Black or African American                 NA                           #> 3       3 Native American                           DM: Subject race is one of â€¦ #> 4       4 Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander NA

title: Secular affirmations against data
text: Load package initialize new affirmation session affirm_init() Run individual affirmationsâ€¦ Create report results
code: library(affirm) #>  #> Attaching package: 'affirm' #> The following object is masked from 'package:stats': #>  #>     filter  # initiate an affirmation session affirm_init(replace = TRUE) #> âœ” We're ready to make data affirmations... as_tibble(mtcars) |>   affirm_true(     label = "No. cylinders must be 4, 6, or 8",     condition = cyl %in% c(4, 6, 8),     id = 1,     data_frames = "mtcars"   ) |>   affirm_true(     label = "MPG should be less than 33",     condition = mpg < 33,     id = 2,     data_frames = "mtcars"   ) #> â€¢ No. cylinders must be 4, 6, or 8 #>   0 issues identified. #> â€¢ MPG should be less than 33 #>   1 issue identified. #> # A tibble: 32 Ã— 11 #>     mpg   cyl  disp    hp  drat    wt  qsec    vs    am  gear  carb #>   <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> #> 1  21       6   160   110  3.9   2.62  16.5     0     1     4     4 #> 2  21       6   160   110  3.9   2.88  17.0     0     1     4     4 #> 3  22.8     4   108    93  3.85  2.32  18.6     1     1     4     1 #> # â„¹ 29 more rows affirm_report_gt()

title: Affirmation Report â€” affirm_report
code: affirm_init(replace = TRUE) #> âœ” We're ready to make data affirmations...  as_tibble(mtcars) |>  affirm_true(    label = "No. cylinders must be 4, 6, or 8",    condition = cyl %in% c(4, 6, 8)  ) |>  affirm_true(     label = "MPG should be less than 33",     condition = mpg < 33  ) #> â€¢ No. cylinders must be 4, 6, or 8 #>   0 issues identified. #> â€¢ MPG should be less than 33 #>   1 issue identified. #> # A tibble: 32 Ã— 11 #>      mpg   cyl  disp    hp  drat    wt  qsec    vs    am  gear  carb #>    <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> #>  1  21       6  160    110  3.9   2.62  16.5     0     1     4     4 #>  2  21       6  160    110  3.9   2.88  17.0     0     1     4     4 #>  3  22.8     4  108     93  3.85  2.32  18.6     1     1     4     1 #>  4  21.4     6  258    110  3.08  3.22  19.4     1     0     3     1 #>  5  18.7     8  360    175  3.15  3.44  17.0     0     0     3     2 #>  6  18.1     6  225    105  2.76  3.46  20.2     1     0     3     1 #>  7  14.3     8  360    245  3.21  3.57  15.8     0     0     3     4 #>  8  24.4     4  147.    62  3.69  3.19  20       1     0     4     2 #>  9  22.8     4  141.    95  3.92  3.15  22.9     1     0     4     2 #> 10  19.2     6  168.   123  3.92  3.44  18.3     1     0     4     4 #> # â„¹ 22 more rows  gt_report <- affirm_report_gt()  affirm_close()

title: Affirm True â€” affirm_true
text: Use function affirm expression true.

title: Affirm True â€” affirm_true
code: affirm_true(   data,   label,   condition,   id = NA_integer_,   priority = NA_integer_,   data_frames = NA_character_,   columns = NA_character_,   report_listing = NULL,   data_action = NULL,   error = getOption("affirm.error", default = FALSE) )

title: Affirm True â€” affirm_true
text: data data frame label string used describe affirmation condition expression check evaluates logical vector, e.g. cyl %% c(4, 6, 8). Use dot (.) reference passed data frame. condition results missing value, interpreted FALSE. id, priority, data_frames, columns Optional additional information passed affirmation report. id must integer, e.g. id = 1L priority must integer, e.g. priority = 1L data_frames string data frame names used affirmation, e.g. data_frames = "RAND, DM" columns string column names used affirmation. default .vars(condition) report_listing expression selecting/filtering rows data= return issue listing report. default return result create_report_listing(), rows met condition= columns included condition= expression along columns set option('affirm.id_cols'). 'affirm.id_cols' option must character vector column names, columns selected select(any_of(getOption('affirm.id_cols'))). data_action expression executed end function call supplied. Default NULL, passed data frame data= returned unaltered. Perhaps need remove problematic rows: data_action = filter(., !(!!condition)) error Logical indicating whether throw error condition met. Default FALSE.

title: Affirm True â€” affirm_true
text: data frame

title: Affirm True â€” affirm_true
text: passing expressions arguments report_listing= data_action=, things keep mind. expression passed condition= can used, note captured expression inside function. means use , need use !! (bang-bang) pass inside function. addition able use condition= expression, can simplify code somewhat referring lgl_condition, evaluated logical vector condition= expression.

title: Affirm Values â€” affirm_values
text: wrapper affirm_true(). column value arguments used construct affirm_true(condition = column %% value) argument.

title: Affirm Values â€” affirm_values
code: affirm_values(   data,   label,   column,   values,   id = NA_integer_,   priority = NA_integer_,   data_frames = NA_character_,   report_listing = NULL,   data_action = NULL,   error = getOption("affirm.error", default = FALSE) )

title: Affirm Values â€” affirm_values
text: data data frame label string used describe affirmation column single column check values values vector values column= may take id, priority, data_frames Optional additional information passed affirmation report. id must integer, e.g. id = 1L priority must integer, e.g. priority = 1L data_frames string data frame names used affirmation, e.g. data_frames = "RAND, DM" report_listing expression selecting/filtering rows data= return issue listing report. default return result create_report_listing(), rows met condition= columns included condition= expression along columns set option('affirm.id_cols'). 'affirm.id_cols' option must character vector column names, columns selected select(any_of(getOption('affirm.id_cols'))). data_action expression executed end function call supplied. Default NULL, passed data frame data= returned unaltered. Perhaps need remove problematic rows: data_action = filter(., !(!!condition)) error Logical indicating whether throw error condition met. Default FALSE.

title: Prepend DF Name to Column Names â€” prepend_df_name
text: data data frame df_name string indicating data frame name prepend column names. supplied, function try identify data frame name. NOTE: can get correct name data frame piped directly function without piped function . include tidyselect expression identify columns modify name. Default columns, except identified options("affirm.id_cols").
